item.content:encoded: In a large US sample, approximately half of all women discontinue antidepressant usage during pregnancy (no change in usage for spouses). This is in a new paper that I just published with @claireeboone and @ccolina_pe that is primarily descriptive.
item.author: Devin Pope

item.content:encoded: Franchisees are much better operators than McDonalds. While systemwide US sales fell 1%, company owned units fell 5%. As a result, company owned restaurant profit (now tiny part of $MCD) fell 33%. Why the great franchise-out made so much sense.
item.author: Rahul Sharma

item.content:encoded: Spouse switched regular coffee with decaf w/o telling me, then followed up later w/ some data collection (which I mistook for a sign of care & interest). Calling the IRB.

item.content:encoded: Modern supply chains don't look like trade theory 101! They involve constant border crossings, each now hit by tariffs. Tariffs raise prices, but the more important thing they do is disrupt supply relationships. 1/ graphic h/t @scottlincicome .

item.content:encoded: It is not a coincidence that every single one of the tech billionaires trying to destroy the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has a lot to gain from a less informed, less protected consumer

item.content:encoded: MasterCard has now outperformed both Apple and Amazon since it's 2006 IPO. Somehow still seems underappreciated.

item.content:encoded: The Economist whips itself into a frenzy about how deReGuLaTiOn is going to spur economic growth and tamper inflation. Too bad there are almost no regulated industries in America to deregulate any longer. Utilities and banks (barely), but nada for tech, telcos, cable, airlines.

item.content:encoded: $WMT outperforming $NFLX by 20%+ (with divvy) for the last 5 years. And as a Walmart shareholder, you didnâ€™t have to suffer a -75% drop in your wealth. If youâ€™d predicted this 5 years ago people would think youâ€™re bananas.

item.content:encoded: $250/mo gyms are not about nicer equipment. The point of a $250 gym membership is to exercise exclusively around other people able and willing to also pay $250/mo. They aren't expensive because they're desirable, they're desirable because they're expensive
